title: Maruti Grand Vitara gets more affordable strong-hybrid, new AWD AT variants
description: After Toyota updated the Urban Cruiser Hyryder with new features and a new variant, Maruti Suzuki has also rolled out similar updates for the Grand Vitara SUV. For 2025, the Maruti Grand Vitara has been updated with a new strong hybrid variant, more features across the board, 6 airbags as standard and an automatic transmission option for the AWD variants. Prices for the 2025 Grand Vitara start from Rs 11.42 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Grand Vitara now gets 6 airbags as standard Panoramic sunroof is now an optional extra on mid and top trims Strong hybrid powertrain made more accessible with the new Delta+ trim 2025 Maruti Grand Vitara variant rejig Strong-hybrid powertrain made more accessible Maruti has introduced a new Delta+ trim for the strong hybrid powertrain, making it a little more accessible. Previously, this powertrain was offered only with the top-spec Zeta+ and Alpha+ trims at prices starting from Rs 18.58 lakh (ex-showroom). The new Delta+ strong hybrid lowers that entry price to Rs 16.99 lakh. Additionally, the 5-speed manual gearbox on the 1.5-litre petrol-AWD variant has been replaced with a new 6-speed automatic gearbox. Maruti Suzuki has also made the panoramic sunroof an optional extra for Rs 60,000 on the Zeta, Alpha, Zeta+ and Alpha+ trims; earlier, it was a standard fit on these trims. Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara new features Safety update Maruti Suzuki is also offering 6 airbags as standard on the updated Grand Vitara. Previously, the base Sigma and Delta trims came with 2 airbags. Other standard safety features on the Grand Vitara include ESP, hill hold assist, ABS and EBD, 3-point seatbelt for all passengers and ISOFIX mounts.   More convenience features added Maruti Suzuki has also added a few comfort and convenience features to the Grand Vitara but hasn’t specified which trims these come in from. These include a new 8-way powered function for the driver’s seat, an electronic parking brake for the automatic variants, an air purifier with PM2.5 display, new LED cabin lamps and rear window sunshades. Maruti has also updated the design of the 17-inch alloy wheels. Other features include a 9-inch infotainment touchscreen, wireless charging and phone connectivity, head-up display, a 360-degree camera and ventilated front seats. Maruti Grand Vitara powertrain and specs The 2025 Grand Vitara continues with two engine options – there’s a 103hp, 137Nm, 1.5-litre, 4-cylinder, naturally aspirated petrol mill that is mated to either a 5-speed manual or 6-speed automatic gearbox. As already mentioned, this engine also gets an all-wheel-drive configuration with the 6AT gearbox. There’s also a 116hp, 1.5-litre, 3-cylinder petrol-strong hybrid powertrain with an e-CVT transmission. html:
Maruti Suzuki has also added more features across the board, including 6 airbags as standard.

After Toyota updated the Urban Cruiser Hyryder with new features and a new variant, Maruti Suzuki has also rolled out similar updates for the Grand Vitara SUV. For 2025, the Maruti Grand Vitara has been updated with a new strong hybrid variant, more features across the board, 6 airbags as standard and an automatic transmission option for the AWD variants. Prices for the 2025 Grand Vitara start from Rs 11.42 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi).

  1. Grand Vitara now gets 6 airbags as standard
  2. Panoramic sunroof is now an optional extra on mid and top trims
  3. Strong hybrid powertrain made more accessible with the new Delta+ trim

2025 Maruti Grand Vitara variant rejig

Strong-hybrid powertrain made more accessible

Maruti has introduced a new Delta+ trim for the strong hybrid powertrain, making it a little more accessible. Previously, this powertrain was offered only with the top-spec Zeta+ and Alpha+ trims at prices starting from Rs 18.58 lakh (ex-showroom). The new Delta+ strong hybrid lowers that entry price to Rs 16.99 lakh.

Additionally, the 5-speed manual gearbox on the 1.5-litre petrol-AWD variant has been replaced with a new 6-speed automatic gearbox.

Maruti Suzuki has also made the panoramic sunroof an optional extra for Rs 60,000 on the Zeta, Alpha, Zeta+ and Alpha+ trims; earlier, it was a standard fit on these trims.

Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara new features

Safety update

Maruti Suzuki is also offering 6 airbags as standard on the updated Grand Vitara. Previously, the base Sigma and Delta trims came with 2 airbags. Other standard safety features on the Grand Vitara include ESP, hill hold assist, ABS and EBD, 3-point seatbelt for all passengers and ISOFIX mounts.  

More convenience features added

Maruti Suzuki has also added a few comfort and convenience features to the Grand Vitara but hasn’t specified which trims these come in from. These include a new 8-way powered function for the driver’s seat, an electronic parking brake for the automatic variants, an air purifier with PM2.5 display, new LED cabin lamps and rear window sunshades. Maruti has also updated the design of the 17-inch alloy wheels.

Other features include a 9-inch infotainment touchscreen, wireless charging and phone connectivity, head-up display, a 360-degree camera and ventilated front seats.

Maruti Grand Vitara powertrain and specs

The 2025 Grand Vitara continues with two engine options – there’s a 103hp, 137Nm, 1.5-litre, 4-cylinder, naturally aspirated petrol mill that is mated to either a 5-speed manual or 6-speed automatic gearbox. As already mentioned, this engine also gets an all-wheel-drive configuration with the 6AT gearbox. There’s also a 116hp, 1.5-litre, 3-cylinder petrol-strong hybrid powertrain with an e-CVT transmission.
